item.title: 泛型和引用权能（Generics and Reference Capabilities）
泛型约束（Constraints）
item.description: Capability Constraints The type parameter constraint for a generic class or method can constrain to a particular capability as seen previously: class Foo[A: Any val] Without the constraint, the generic must work for all possible capabilities. Sometimes you don’t want to be limited to a specific capability and you can’t support all capabilities. The solution for this is generic constraint qualifiers. These represent classes of capabilities that are accepted in the generic.
